0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Prepare and submit accurate and complete Harmonized System (HS) codes for export shipments.
Ensure compliance with all applicable customs regulations, laws, and tariffs when clearing international shipments.
Verify the authenticity of commercial invoices, certificates of origin, and other required documentation for imported goods.
Coordinate with clients to gather necessary information and documentation for their international trade transactions.
Provide clients with up-to-date information on changes in customs regulations, laws, and tariffs that may impact their operations.
Monitor and resolve discrepancies or issues related to customs clearance, including resolving shipments that are stuck at the port.
Maintain accurate records of client shipments, including tracking numbers, delivery dates, and any issues encountered during transit.
Prepare and submit customs declarations for international shipments, including goods destined for both personal use and commercial purposes.
Clear shipments from local authorities on behalf of clients who do not have a valid business license or other required permits.
Negotiate with freight forwarders, airlines, and other carriers to resolve issues related to damaged or lost shipments.
Conduct research on import regulations and compliance requirements for specific countries or regions to ensure accurate clearance procedures.
Provide customs brokerage services for clients who are new to international trade and require guidance on compliance procedures.
Develop and maintain relationships with local government officials, freight forwarders, and other stakeholders to facilitate smooth imports and exports.
Stay up-to-date with changes in international trade laws, regulations, and tariffs by attending industry conferences, seminars, and workshops.
Assist clients with the customs clearance process for shipments containing restricted or regulated goods.
Facilitate communication between clients, freight forwarders, airlines, and other carriers to ensure smooth logistics and minimize delays.
Prepare and submit necessary documentation to support claims related to lost, stolen, or damaged shipments.
Coordinate with local authorities to resolve issues related to customs seizures, confiscations, or fines associated with non-compliant shipments.
Conduct regular audits of client files to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and identify areas for improvement in their operations.
Provide clients with guidance on how to properly classify goods under the Harmonized System (HS) code system.
Prepare and submit necessary documentation to support claims related to errors or discrepancies on commercial invoices or other supporting documents.
1: Develop, implement, and evaluate training programs to enhance employee skills and performance.
Create and maintain curriculum frameworks, syllabi, and learning materials for various training sessions.
Design and deliver instructor-led training sessions, workshops, or webinars on specific topics or skills.
Conduct needs assessments and analysis to identify training gaps and opportunities for improvement.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to develop and review training content, ensuring accuracy and relevance.
Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs, identifying areas for improvement and recommending changes as needed.
Develop and maintain relationships with vendors, suppliers, and partners to secure training resources and services.
Assist in the development and management of organizational change initiatives, aligning training programs with business objectives.
Coordinate logistics for large-scale training events, conferences, or workshops, including venue selection, catering, and audiovisual equipment.
Monitor and report on training metrics, such as participant engagement, retention rates, and return-on-investment (ROI), to stakeholders.
Develop and manage a training budget, allocating resources effectively to achieve organizational objectives.
2: Prepares high-quality meals in accordance with nutritional guidelines and institutional standards.
Maintains a clean and sanitary kitchen environment to prevent cross-contamination and ensure food safety.
Plans and orders ingredients for daily menus, considering budget constraints and dietary restrictions.
Executes cooking techniques and recipes accurately and efficiently during meal service.
Instructs and supervises kitchen staff on proper food preparation and handling procedures.
Monitors food inventory levels to minimize waste and optimize ordering.
Ensures compliance with institutional and regulatory standards for food safety, quality, and sanitation.
Provides exceptional customer service, addressing dietary needs and preferences in a timely manner.
Maintains accurate records of food orders, inventory, and menu revisions.
Trains new staff members on kitchen procedures and protocols to ensure smooth operation.
Inventories food items and supplies at the end of each day/week, reporting discrepancies to management.
Conducts regular taste tests to evaluate menu items and provide feedback for quality improvement.
